dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 726 IH: To amend the Native American Programs Act of 1974 to reauthorize a provision to ensure the survival and continuing vitality of Native American languages.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Ben Ray Luj√°n of New Mexico (for himself, Ms. Hanabusa, Ms. Roybal-Allard, Mr. Moran, Mrs. Negrete McLeod, Ms. Slaughter, Ms. McCollum, and Mr. Pearce) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Native American Programs Act of 1974 to reauthorize a provision to ensure the survival and continuing vitality of Native American languages.

section.header: Reauthorization of Native American languages program
section.text: Section 816(e) of the Native American Programs Act of 1974 (42 U.S.C. 2992d(e)) is amended by striking 2008, 2009, 2010, 2011, and 2012 and inserting 2013 through 2017.
